item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description: <p>US banking varies wildly from state-to-state in my experience. My main bank in Indiana could give me a card and PIN there and then. The affiliate branch in Tampa could do nothing of the sort.</p><p>Whereas in the UK, <b>all</b> banks are crap <img src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLY/$FILE/smile.gif"</a>> See, we're consistent.</p>
item.content:encoded:
US banking varies wildly from state-to-state in my experience. My main bank in Indiana could give me a card and PIN there and then. The affiliate branch in Tampa could do nothing of the sort.

Whereas in the UK, all banks are crap http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLY/$FILE/smile.gif“> See, we’re consistent.

item.title: By: Richard Schwartz
item.dc:creator: Richard Schwartz
item.description: <p>I don't know what bank Sean deals with. The bank I deal with here in the US would need to send me a new card from one location and a new PIN code from another location. And for the duration not only would I not be able to use the ATM machines for cash, but I also would not be able to use the bank's web access for my account either, since it uses the ATM card number. Five business days sounds about right. Although admittedly, I haven't been through this for a few years. </p>
item.content:encoded: I don’t know what bank Sean deals with. The bank I deal with here in the US would need to send me a new card from one location and a new PIN code from another location. And for the duration not only would I not be able to use the ATM machines for cash, but I also would not be able to use the bank’s web access for my account either, since it uses the ATM card number. Five business days sounds about right. Although admittedly, I haven’t been through this for a few years.

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>The scary thing is that apparently I am a "premier" customer, normal mortals wouldn't get their card for an even longer period!</p>
item.content:encoded: The scary thing is that apparently I am a “premier” customer, normal mortals wouldn’t get their card for an even longer period!

item.title: By: Sean Burgess
item.dc:creator: Sean Burgess
item.description: <p>This is the difference between the British and American way of doing business. If I lose my card, I can walk into my bank branch and walk out with a new card. Or I can call the 24x7 help line and have one sent to my over night, without any additional cost.</p><p>Sean---</p>
item.content:encoded:
This is the difference between the British and American way of doing business. If I lose my card, I can walk into my bank branch and walk out with a new card. Or I can call the 24×7 help line and have one sent to my over night, without any additional cost.

Sean—
